metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5868 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 76.0.3809.100 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted PDF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 76.0.3809.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 76.0.3809.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 76.0.3809.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 76.0.3809.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 76.0.3809.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0.3809.100-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
